member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.AbstractBluetoothStack
member.summary: This class will represent the currently loaded bluetooth stack. Respective functionality must be implemented in the derived classes. Common functionality is handled in here. Purpose of this class is to provide a common interface between two different bluetooth stacks.

member.name: F:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Resources.m_rmNameValues
member.summary: ResourceManager object to access the string table

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Resources.#cctor
member.summary: Static constructor, initialize access to the string table

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Resources.GetString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a string from the string table

members.member:
Begins enumeration of services provided by a device.
\param ServiceFind Pointer to the service enumeration handle. \param ServiceInfo Pointer to a structure to receive service information. \param ServiceQuery Pointer to structure providing filtering for the services that will be returned.
\return Returns a status code indicating success or failure.

Retrieves the next service in the enumeration.
\param ServiceFind Service enumeration handle. \param ServiceInfo Pointer to structure to receive service information.
\return Returns a status code indicating success or failure.

Terminates the service discovery and frees associated resources.
\param ServiceFind Service enumeration handle.
\return Returns a status code indicating success or failure.

Connects to a persistent connection (Favorite).
\param ConnectionID Reference to the connection to connect.
\return Returns a status code indicating success or failure.

Terminates an active connection.
\param ConnectionID Reference to the connection to disconnect.
\return Returns a status code indicating success or failure.

Defines a callback for authentication requests associated with a specified device.
\param BD_ADDR Pointer to the device identifier. \param AuthenticationCallback Pointer to the function to be called when authentication is required. \param CallbackParameter User defined parameter.
\return Returns a status code indicating success or failure.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth
member.summary: This class creates the Bluetooth object. NOTE: When targeting Stonestreet One bluetooth stack, the requirement is BTExplorer version 1.2.5 build 19090 or higher.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.Enable
member.summary: Enable the Bluetooth API. Enabling the Bluetooth API is optional. If the application does not explicitly enable the Bluetooth API, it will be enabled automatically when required. NOTE: If the Bluetooth radio is currently turned OFF, then enabling the Bluetooth object will automatically turn the radio ON.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.Disable
member.summary: Disable the Bluetooth API. If the application does not explicitely disable the API, the Bluetooth class library will disable it in the Dispose() method. NOTE: Disable will also close all open ports in the RemoteDevices list. Disabling the Bluetooth object does not turn OFF the Bluetooth radio. The state of the Bluetooth radio can be changed using the Bluetooth.RadioMode property.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the Bluetooth object and free allocated resources. An exiting application must call this method in order to free all resources and prevent memory leaks. NOTE: If there is an asynchronous refresh operation currently in progress, dispose will cancel it and perform the cleanup. In this scenario, Dispose() may take a few seconds to cancel the asynchronous refresh operation.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.RefreshAvailableComPorts
member.summary: Refreshed the latest available com ports on the local device.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices
member.summary: Provides a collection of RemoteDevice objects

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.Version
member.summary: Provides the Bluetooth version information. NOTE: To manully determine the Stonestreet One BTExplorer version, refer to the Programmer's guide.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.LocalDeviceName
member.summary: Provides the name of the local device.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.LocalDeviceAddress
member.summary: Provides the Bluetooth address of the local device. Note: For Stonestreet One Bluetooth Stack, this property is supported only on devices with BTExplorer build 24486 and above.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.LocalComPorts
member.summary: Provides COM ports listed on the local device for Bluetooth serial communication. One of the ports from this list can be used to set the "LocalComPort" property of the RemoteDevice class. This list is dynamically updated to provide only the local COM ports that are available for use at that time. NOTE: The user can also manually set the RemoteDevice.LocalComPort property to any COM port available for Bluetooth serial communication.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.LoadedStack
member.summary: Provides the Bluetooth stack loaded on the device. NOTE: We recommend using the default Bluetooth stack that is shipped with the device. However, if LoadedStack property is modified, a warmboot is required for the latest stack to take effect. Please note that all devices do not support all stacks.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.RadioMode
member.summary: Provides the Bluetooth radio mode. NOTE: For Microsoft stack, discoverable only mode (BTH_DISCOVERABLE) is not supported. If BTH_DISCOVERABLE is used, the radio mode is automatically set to BTH_DISCOVERABLE_AND_CONNECTABLE.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth.IsEnabled
member.summary: Checks if the Bluetooth APIs are enabled.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.OperationFailureException
member.summary: OperationFailureException is thrown when a failure occurs in the class library. This failure usually is one that stops the proper functioning of the class library.
member.remarks: Derived off of the System.Exception class, this exception provides a results enum to be associated with the exception, via the Result property.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.OperationFailureException.#ctor(System.String,Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.BluetoothResults)
member.summary: OperationFailureException constructor with settable string and results enum.
member.param: A string the contains information about the exception.
A Results enumerated type that contains information about the exception.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.OperationFailureException.Result
member.summary: The BluetoothResults associated with the exception.
member.value: An integer result that contains information about what caused the exception.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.InvalidUsageException
member.summary: InvalidUsageException is thrown when an invalid usage is detected by the class library.
member.remarks: Derived off of the System.Exception class, this exception provides an informaion enum to be associated with the exception, via the Info property.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.InvalidUsageException.#ctor(System.String,Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.BluetoothResults)
member.summary: InvalidUsageException constructor with settable string and results enum.
member.param: A string the contains information about the exception.
A Results enumerated type that contains information about the exception.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.InvalidUsageException.Info
member.summary: The BluetoothResults associated with the exception.
member.value: An integer result that contains information about what caused the exception.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.MinorClassOfDevice
member.summary: List of supported minor classes of devices for each major device class The enumeration entries are grouped according to major class. The individual entries start with the major class name, followed by underscore and minor class name. Format: [MAJORCLASS]_[MINORCLASS] Eg: IMAGING_PRINTER

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.ClassOfDevice
member.summary: Provides the Class of Device information Class of Device is used to indicate device type category and other device-specific characteristics. It is categorized into Major, Minor and Sub-Minor types

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.ClassOfDevice.MajorClass
member.summary: Provides the Major class of the remote device

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.ClassOfDevice.MinorClass
member.summary: Provides the Minor class of the remote device

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.ClassOfDevice.SubMinorClass
member.summary: Provides the subcategory in the minor class of the remote device

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.QueryClassOfDevice
member.summary: Provides the class of device information used to restrict the device query process to the specified device class information.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.QueryClassOfDevice.SetFilter(Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.MajorClassofDevice,Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.MinorClassOfDevice,Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.SubMinorClassOfDevice)
member.summary: Sets the class of device information, used for filtering the remote devices during the device query process. After calling this method, when the application either enumerates the remote devices list or calls RemoteDevices.Refresh() method, a new device discovery will be performed and the remote devices list will be updated. The updated list will contain only remote devices that match the specified class of device information.
member.param: Major class of remote device to query

Minor class of remote device to query.
The minor class parameter must correspond to the major class parameter. If not, BluetoothResults.INVALID_PARAMETER is returned and the filter will not be set. For example, if MajorClassofDevice.IMAGING is the chosen Major class, then the application has the option of choosing one of the minor classes (IMAGING_PRINTER, IMAGING_CAMERA, IMAGING_SCANNER, IMAGING_PRINTER or IMAGING_ALL), that is associated with the IMAGING major class.
Currently for IMAGING major class alone, a combination of minor classes can be passed for the minor class parameter. For example: IMAGING_PRINTER | IMAGING_SCANNER IMAGING_PRINTER | IMAGING_SCANNER | IMAGING_DISPLAY NOTE: The combination of minor classes is currently applicable only to IMAGING major class.

Subcategory in minor class of remote device to query. NOTE: Currently subminor class parameter is applicable for PERIPHERAL major class only. Because, currently only PERIPHERAL major class has subcategories for its minor classes. For other major classes, the application can pass either SubMinorClassOfDevice.UNKNOWN or SubMinorClassOfDevice.UNUSED for this parameter.
member.returns: BluetoothResults.SUCCESS - If sucessfull in setting the filter. BluetoothResults.INVALID_PARAMETER - If incorrect combination of parameters are passed

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.QueryClassOfDevice.ClearFilter
member.summary: Clears the class of device information, used for filtering the remote devices during the device query process. After calling this method, when the application either enumerates the remote devices list or calls RemoteDevices.Refresh() method, a new device discovery will be performed and the remote devices list will be updated. The updated list will contain all discovered remote devices.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices
member.summary: This class provides access to the remote Bluetooth devices.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.#ctor(Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Bluetooth)
member.summary: The constructor.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the RemoteDevices list. This method works both synchronously and asynchronously. For more information, refer to the "Remarks" section.

remarks.para: Asynchronous - When an event handler is attached to RefreshNotify event and this Refresh() method is called, it works asynchronously. The RefreshNotify event is raised during different states of the asynchronous refresh. The event handler provides the RefreshNotifyEventArgs object which contains Status along with the latest RemoteDevice added to the RemoteDevices list.

Synchronous - When no event handler is attached to RefreshNotify event and this Refresh() method is called, it works synchronously. After the Refresh() method returns, the RemoteDevices list contains the updated list of remote devices.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.RefreshCancel
member.summary: Cancels the current asynchronous Refresh() operation. NOTE: This method returns immediately without blocking. Once the cancel is complete, the RefreshNotify event is raised with the Status set to CANCELLED.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.Add(Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice)
member.summary: Adds a new remote device to the RemoteDevices collection maintained by the class library. It does not update the remote devices list in the Bluetooth stack. This method will not validate the existence of the remote device.
member.param: A RemoteDevice object

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.Delete(Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice)
member.summary: Deletes a device from the RemoteDevices collection maintained by the class library. It does not update the remote devices list in the Bluetooth stack.
member.param: Remote device to be deleted from the list

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.DeleteAll
member.summary: Delete all the devices in the RemoteDevices collection maintained by the class library. It does not update the remote devices list in the Bluetooth stack.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.UnPairAll
member.summary: Unpairs all the remote devices in the RemoteDevices collection.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.QueryAttributes
member.summary: This attribute will be used to query the available remote devices. By default all devices will be queried. Applicable only for StoneStreet Bluetooth Stack.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.QueryMaxDevices
member.summary: Applicable only for Microsoft stack. Maximum number of devices to retrieve information about before stopping the inquiry. Default value is 16.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.QueryTimeout
member.summary: Maximum time duration allowed to perform device query. Default value is 10 secs. The allowed range of values for this property is 0 to 255. NOTE: The QueryTimeout only represents the duration during which the remote devices are identified. The discovery process also includes retrieving device names, which may take additional time.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.QueryClassofDevice
member.summary: Specifies the class of device information used to restrict the device query process. After setting the information, when the application either enumerates the list or calls Refresh() method, a new device discovery will be performed and the remote devices list will be updated. The updated list will contain only remote devices that match the specified class of device information.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.Length
member.summary: Length of the remote devices collection maintained by the class library. NOTE: When remote devices are enumerated for the first time, a discovery of remote devices will be performed and the list will be created. This list will get updated when the application explicitly calls the Refresh() method. The list also gets updated, when the application sets the Class of device filter by calling QueryClassOfDevice.SetFilter(...), and either enumerates the list or calls Refresh() method.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides access to available remote devices. NOTE: When remote devices are enumerated for the first time, a discovery of remote devices will be performed and the list will be created. This list will get updated when the application explicitly calls the Refresh() method. The list also gets updated, when the application sets the Class of device filter by calling QueryClassOfDevice.SetFilter(...), and either enumerates the list or calls Refresh() method.
member.param: The indexer provided to enumerate RemoteDevice objects in the list.

member.name: E:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.RefreshNotify
member.summary: Event raised during the asynchronous Refresh() to indicate the various states of the refresh operation. For more information, refer to the "Remarks" section.
member.remarks:
The RefreshNotify event is raised to indicate the following:
Discovery Start: Indicates the start of the discovery. This start event will be raised before the first device is discovered. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Status is set to STARTED. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.RemoteDevice is set to null.
Discovery Progress:
Indicates that the discovery is in progress. This will be raised for each RemoteDevice added to the RemoteDevices list. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Status is set to INPROGRESS. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.RemoteDevice provides the latest RemoteDevice added to the RemoteDevices list.
Discovery Completed:
Indicates that the discovery has completed. This completion event will be raised after the final event for the last RemoteDevice. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Status is set to COMPLETED. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.RemoteDevice is set to null.
Discovery Cancelled:
Indicates that the discovery has been cancelled. This cancellation event will be raised after the user calls RefreshCancel(..). RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Status is set to CANCELLED. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.RemoteDevice is set to null.
Discovery Error:
Indicates that the discovery has failed. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Status is set to ERROR RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Result provides the specific error. RefreshNotifyEventArgs.RemoteDevice is set to null.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevices.RefreshNotifyEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate for the RefreshNotify event handler.
member.param: The source of the event
The RefreshNotifyEventArgs object which contains the RefreshNotify event related data

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RefreshNotifyEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about the RefreshNotify event raised during the asynchronous refresh operation.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RefreshNotifyEventArgs.RemoteDevice
member.summary: Provides the latest remote device added to the RemoteDevices list. This remote device can be either newly discovered or custom added by the user. NOTE: All devices in the RemoteDevices list, including custom remote devices, will be provided through RefreshNotify event handler.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Count
member.summary: Provides the number of remote devices currently present in the RemoteDevices list.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Status
member.summary: Provides the current status of the asynchronous refresh operation.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RefreshNotifyEventArgs.Result
member.summary: If the Status is ERROR, this property provides the specific error. For other status, it gives BluetoothResults.SUCCESS.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice
member.summary: This class represents a remote device.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The constructor. Before the RemoteDevice object can be used, it must be added to the RemoteDevices object by calling its Add() function. Note: A better performance can be achieved by using the other overloaded constructor passing the RFCOMMPort (if RFCOMMPort is known by the user). To get more information on using a custom RemoteDevice object, refer to "Custom remote device" section of "Bluetooth Programming" guide. This guide is located in the WPAN section of the Programmer's Guide in the Help file.
member.param: Name of the remote device
Address of the remote device. This param is optional if the param Name is provided. If the Address is not provided, the first available remote device with the matching Name will be used for pairing
The name of the service to use on the remote device. If an empty string is passed, the first available serial service will be used.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The constructor. Before the RemoteDevice object can be used, it must be added to the RemoteDevices object by calling its Add() function. Note: Providing the RFCOMMPort may result in a better performance during pairing. If you do not know the RFCOMMPort of the remote device, you should use the other constructor providing the service name. To get more information on using a custom RemoteDevice object, refer to "Custom remote device" section of "Bluetooth Programming" guide. This guide is located in the WPAN section of the Programmer's Guide in the Help file.
member.param: Name of the remote device
Address of the remote device. This param is optional if the param Name is provided. If the Address is not provided, the first available remote device with the matching Name will be used for pairing
The RFCOMM port to use on the remote device.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Pair
member.summary:
During the Bluetooth Pairing two Bluetooth devices will agree to communicate with one another.
Connects to the remote device. No authentication will be done. If the remote device requires authentication, any attempts to communicate with the remote device will fail. If the property "LocalComPort" of this class is not set, the first available com port will be used. If the property "ServiceName" of this class is not set, the first available remote service of type BTP_PROFILE_SPP will be selected. NOTE: Before calling pair, the remote device object must be added to the RemoteDevices array in the bluetooth object. If not, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Pair(System.String)
member.summary:
During the Bluetooth Pairing two Bluetooth devices will agree to communicate with one another.
Connects to the remote device and uses the authentication PIN if required by the remote device. If the authentication PIN provided does not match the remote device, any attempts to communicate with the remote device will fail. If the property "LocalComPort" of this class is not set, the first available com port will be used. If the property "ServiceName" of this class is not set, the first available remote service of type BTP_PROFILE_SPP will be selected. NOTE: Before calling pair, the remote device object must be added to the RemoteDevices array in the bluetooth object. If not, an exception is thrown.
member.param: Authentication PIN used during the pairing. This PIN must match the PIN set on the remote device

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.OpenPort
member.summary: Opens the communication port. Pairing must be done before calling this method. NOTE: Using this method to perform serial communication is optional. Any Microsoft API can be used for serial communication after the pairing is completed.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.ClosePort
member.summary: Closes the opened port NOTE: Using this method to perform serial communication is optional. Any Microsoft API can be used for serial communication after the pairing is completed.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.UnPair
member.summary: Disconnects from the remote device.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Read(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads from the device. NOTE: The number of bytes read can be less than the number of bytes requested. The user needs to check the size of the returned array to ensure they receive the correct number of bytes. NOTE: Using this method to perform serial communication is optional. Any Microsoft API can be used for serial communication after the pairing is completed.
member.param: Number of bytes to read from the com port.
member.returns: Returns the data read from the serial port in a byte array

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Read(System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Reads from the device. NOTE: The number of bytes read can be less than the number of bytes requested. The user needs to check the size of the returned array to ensure they receive the correct number of bytes. NOTE: Using this method to perform serial communication is optional. Any Microsoft API can be used for serial communication after the pairing is completed.
member.param: Number of bytes to read from the com port.
Timeout (in milliseconds) for the read operation. Default value is 5000ms.
member.returns: Returns the data read from the serial port in a byte array

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes to the device. NOTE: Using this method to perform serial communication is optional. Any Microsoft API can be used for serial communication after the pairing is completed.
member.param: Writes an array of bytes to the com port.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Write(System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes to the device. NOTE: Using this method to perform serial communication is optional. Any Microsoft API can be used for serial communication after the pairing is completed.
member.param: Writes an array of bytes to the com port.
Timeout (in milliseconds) for the write operation. Default value is 5000ms.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Name
member.summary: Name of the device.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.IsPaired
member.summary: Specifies whether the local device is paired with the remote device.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.Address
member.summary: RemoteDeviceAddress of the device.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.ServiceName
member.summary: Name of the service to use on the remote device. The service name is specified through the constructor.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.IsComPortOpened
member.summary: Specifies whether the local com port is opened and ready for communication.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.LocalComPort
member.summary: The local COM port to use for this remote device.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.ReadTimeout
member.summary: Timeout (in milliseconds) for the read operation. Default value is 5000ms.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.WriteTimeout
member.summary: Timeout (in milliseconds) for the write operation. Default value is 5000ms.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.RFCOMMPort
member.summary: RFCOMM port to use on the remote device. It is specified through the overloaded RemoteDevice constructor. If it is not provided in the constructor, the RFCOMM port is automatically determined during the pairing process, and so this property will be updated after calling Pair() or Pair(AuthenticationPIN). For more information on RFCOMMPort refer to the constructor.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.ClassOfDevice
member.summary: Provides the class of device (COD) information of the remote device

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.IsCustomDevice
member.summary: Specifies if this is a custom remote device created and added to the RemoteDevices list

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.RemoteDevice.IsDiscovered
member.summary: Specifies if this remote device was discovered when performing a Refresh() operation. This property can be used to identify devices that are present in the RemoteDevices list but were not discovered during the last Refresh() operation.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Version
member.summary: This class provides the Bluetooth version information. NOTE: The version information is not available for the Stonestreet One Bluetooth. Refer to the Programmer's guide to determine the version information.

member.name: M:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Version.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Version.HCI_Version
member.summary: Host Controller Interface (HCI) version. NOTE: Applicable only to Microsoft Bluetooth stack.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Version.HCI_Revision
member.summary: Host Controller Interface (HCI) revision. NOTE: Applicable only to Microsoft Bluetooth stack.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Version.LMP_Version
member.summary: Link Manager Protocol (LMP) version. NOTE: Applicable only to Microsoft Bluetooth stack.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Version.LMP_SubVersion
member.summary: Link Manager Protocol (LMP) sub-version. NOTE: Applicable only to Microsoft Bluetooth stack.

member.name: P:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.Version.BTExplorerVersion
member.summary: BTExplorer version information. NOTE: Applicable only to Stonestreet One Bluetooth stack.

member.name: T:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.BTH_QUERY_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Bluetooth query attributes

member.name: F:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.BTH_QUERY_ATTRIBUTES.BTP_DEVICE_NONE
member.summary: None

member.summary: Authenticated

member.name: F:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.BTH_QUERY_ATTRIBUTES.BTP_DEVICE_REMEMBERED
member.summary: Rememberd

member.name: F:Symbol.WPAN.Bluetooth.BTH_QUERY_ATTRIBUTES.BTP_DEVICE_CONNECTED
member.summary: Connected
